questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

The error in the exhibit was received while an administrator was trying to connect to a Horizon ADSI database from a Connection Server.
What change does the administrator need to make in the UI to connect to the ADSI database?

choices.D: Microsoft GPO update rules apply and GPOs are updated manually or by restarting the Horizon Agent.
choices.C: Horizon Client detects the change and prompts the user to reboot once every 480 seconds.
choices.B: VMware Tools detects the change and immediately applies the new setting within 480 seconds.
choices.A: VMware Tools services is restarted by Microsoft GPO Update service.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Applying VMware Blast Policy Settings
If the following VMware Blast policies change during a client session, Horizon Client detects the change and immediately applies the new setting.

H264
Audio Playback
Max Session Bandwidth
Min Session Bandwidth
Max Frame Rate
Image Quality
For all other VMware Blast policies, Microsoft GPO update rules apply. GPOs can be updated manually or by restarting the Horizon Agent machine. For more information, see the Microsoft documentation.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon/2206/horizon-remote-desktop-features/GUID-220442CF-EA01-470E-A381-1BED9BC0B81C.html

questions.question_text: What is the effect of changing any VMware Blast policy that cannot be changed in real time?
Which two built-in apps are supported and automatically added to the profile of a multi-app kiosk profile? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
Microsoft is also correct. 3 options are possible here...

Microsoft Word, Camera, and Sticky Notes are not built-in apps that are automatically added to a multi-app kiosk profile.

Therefore, the correct answers are A. Calculator and C. Microsoft Edge.
I wonder if you choose AC on the test would it be mark incorrect.
Microsoft Edge is also correct. 3 options are possible here...

Drag and drop each Horizon console predefined role on the left to its matching function on the right.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Horizon-7/7.13/horizon-administration/GUID-ADC0577C-C1EF-485D-814B-43DF17D5F2C4.html
inventory administrator--> Performs all deskto,session, and..
Local Administrator --> No rights to manage Cloud pod or the global...
Administrator --> Performs all administrative functions and applies to an access group.

Answer is :
Inventory administrator--> Performs all deskto,session, and..
Local Administrator --> No rights to manage Cloud pod or the global...
Administrator --> Performs all administrative functions and applies to an access group.
